chapter.title: RDB Logging - org.cstudio.sns.jms2rdb
chapter.para: The plugin org.cstudio.sns.jms2rdb is a tool that listens to JMS messages from the log, alarm system or other CSS applications and sends them to the RDB.

This tool uses an RDB schema for messages that extends the basic schema described in by adding the following commonly used message properties to the MESSAGE table itself:
TYPE: The message type, for example log or alarm.
SEVERITY: The severity of the message, for example ERROR or MINOR.
NAME: A name associated with the message. For log messages, this is typically the name of the Java method that logged the information. For alarm messages, this is the name of the Process Variable that triggered the alarm.

sect1.title: Relational Database Setup
sect1.para: The dbd sub-directory of the plugin sources describes the RDB schema for MySQL, Oracle and PostgreSQL.

sect1.title: Building the Tool
sect1.para: Use the JMS2RDB.product file to generate the binary.

sect1.title: Running the Tool
sect1.para: You configure the connection parameters for JMS and your RDB via a plugin customization file as described in . Refer to the file plugin_customization.ini included in the JMS2RDB plugin sources for an example.

Once running, the JMS2RDB tool provides a web browser interface as a basic status monitor under the URL http://localhost:4913/main
The port number can be adjusted in the preference settings of the tool. To connect from another computer, replace localhost with the name of the host that is executing the tool.

The main web page will look similar to , displaying the last message that was received and written to the RDB. In case of errors, an addition Last Error section will display for example the last database access error.
To stop the tool, access the URL http://localhost:4913/stop
